Preformmated text also has the same problem.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15863].
  {panel}

The APIs for moving a page currently conflate these three activities, I suspect because that's the way it's done in the user interface:

* Moving a page to a new space
* Moving a page to a new parent
* Moving a page to a different order within the same parent

This makes the APIs (and implementations) really complicated and is the source of a bunch of bugs. It would be much better if the API treated these things as three separate operations that could then be composed.

Some care would have to be taken: for example if you move a page to a new space then change its parent, you shouldn't have to rebuild the ancestor table more than once. Still, that's eminently doable.
fields.summary: Untangle "move page" APIs
Add an option to the user macro creation to allow macros to declare themselves as either block or inline

fields.description:
Confluence 3 contains a permissions change whereby the "remove page" permissions is required to move a page.
The requirement for this change was to prevent users from moving pages from a space where they don't have "remove page" permission to a space where they do have "remove page" permission and then deleting the page.  There is no reason for the "remove page" permission to be required in order to move a page *within the same space*.  

The change was made to fix CONF-15047.
fields.summary: Pages can't be moved even within the same space
Clean up attachment upload actions

fields.description:
See RNDR-85

Inline macros (those that can be placed inside a paragraph) are rendered as blocks in the wysiwyg editor.  This breaks any paragraph level markup around them, such as style tags or links.

{noformat:title=eg}
_foo {nolink:http://www.atlassian.com}nolink_

*foo {cheese} bar*
{noformat}

Will not display any bold in the RTE, and will not round-trip correctly.  (Quick testing suggests that the round-tripping may not have worked for a while, as does [CONF-15460], but it used to at least *display* correctly in the rte, and maintain *some* of the emphasis after round-trip.

I think it should be an easyish fix and think any side-effects of the fix will be less bad than the bug.

This bug is a superset of [CONF-15853]
fields.summary: Wiki Markup around inline macros is not rendered in wysiwyg mode and therefore lost
Links containing inline macros round-trip badly using RTE
Gliffy macro can cause a system error when clicked in Preview mode

fields.description:
If the process of rebuilding the index gets interupted by a shutdown or restart of Confluence, it doesn't fininsh reindexing on the next startup.

This is particulary affecting upgrades where we sometimes need to trigger a rebuild of the index. If that task fails it is never retriggered again which leaves Confluence in an inconsistent state after the upgrade.

A solution would be to keep a marker file somewhere as soon as the reindexing is started and only remove it once the reindexing is finished. That way we can restart the indexing on startup if such a file is present.
fields.summary: Index rebuilding doesn't survive a restart

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15831].
  {panel}

If an attachment has many versions (in the tens thousands range), it can cause Confluence to crash with an OOM when viewing the view attachments page. This is because the view attachments page renders a list of all attachments on a page as well as all its versions (its versions are just added a class hidden and the arrow to display them just toggles this class).

We should either load the previous version only when the user clicks on the arrow by an AJAX call, or even provide a paginated view of such a large number of versions. 

If if the attachment does not have version in the tens of thousands, but does have a significant amount, it will cause the attachments page rendering time to degrade badly. 

Thus this solution should not only consider prevent the OOME but also keeping the page load time scalable.
fields.summary: Better handling of the View Attachments page when there are many versions of an attachment

fields.description:
This issue targets the performance problems on the people directory related to _searching the index_. (other performance problems related to querying user repositories for user information is not addressed here). 

Given the current implementation of people directory, looking at results between: 

- 100 - 200 will cost 2 searches
- 200 - 400 will cost 3 searches
- 400 - 800 will cost 4 searches and so on

This explains why it loading the first page of results is faster than pages further ahead.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15783].
  {panel}

Confluence doesn't seem to query for exactly what attributes it wants when it pulls information from ldap; LDAP ends up sending every attribute of every hit it comes across.  This could mean huge amounts of worthless data being sent to confluence. 

For instance, the manage groups screen does this query:
{code}
          [20ms] - AOP: UserAccessor.getGroups()
            [6ms] - com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.adaptor.LDAPStaticGroupAdaptor_search(com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LiteralFilter@df8b06)
              [6ms] - com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.adaptor.LDAPStaticGroupAdaptor_search_JNDI_RAW_((&(objectClass=groupOfUniqueNames)(objectClass=groupOfUniqueNames)))
                [2ms] - com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.repository.DefaultLdapContextFactory_getLDAPContext
            [10ms] - com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.search.page.LDAPEntityPager_preload__(originalQuery= (&(objectClass=groupOfUniqueNames)(objectClass=groupOfUniqueNames)))

{code}

Which gives it all the attributes of anything matching the query, when all manage groups really cares about is the group name attribute.

For very large ldap instances, this represents a signficant performance penalty.
This could be partially mitigated of this by requesting only the cn for the manage groups screen, and further zeroing in on only relevant attributes when a ldapsearch is done
fields.summary: LDAP perfromance in certain areas could be improved for instances hooked up to large LDAP instances with lots of entries

                [2ms] - com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.repository.DefaultLdapContextFactory_getLDAPContext
            [10ms] - com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.search.page.LDAPEntityPager_preload__(originalQuery= (&(objectClass=groupOfUniqueNames)(objectClass=groupOfUniqueNames)))

{code}

It doesn't really seem to affect anything, as it's a logical tautology, but it's obviously not quite right.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15779].
  {panel}

*Symptoms:*
Anything that is using DWR will fail. Meaning: page editor is fully or partially unusable and it may display the text "Draft saving timed out" on top of the text area. At the same time, the following error messages are printed in the Confluence log:
{noformat}
2009-05-15 08:06:36,011 ERROR [http-83.149.65.63:8443-10]  [org.directwebremoting.dwrp.Batch] error A request has been denied as a potential CSRF attack.
- referer: https://confluenceURL/pages/editpage.action?pageId=720900 | url: /dwr/call/plaincall/DraftAjax.getDraftSaveInterval.dwr | userName: admin
{noformat}

*Cause:*
1). If you change the JSESSIONID in the Application configuration in Websphere (Application Server > serverName > Web Container > Session Management > Cookies), a message appears both in the UI and the logs:

"A request has been denied as a potential CSRF attack."

If for any reason the jessionid is different than "JSESSIONID", this error occurs. In Websphere, In a shared environment, the session IDs are modified to be unique to each JVM, so that each application can get the appropriate requests. Confluence throws this error under that condition. 

2). It can also happen if proxy rewriting rules are interfering and changing the session id.

The workaround is to not change the Jsessionid or fix up the proxy rewrite rules. 

The improvement request is to handle differently named jsessionids.
fields.summary: CSRF attack message thrown when JSESSIONID is changed

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15761].
  {panel}

This issue is related to a customer problem report from [CSP-32272|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-32272].

To reproduce the bug please test with the attached minimal macro implementation that displays the result of the RenderContext.getOutputType() method. Source code is included as well.

To reproduce the bug, create two pages, named "original" and "include".

The page "original" should contain the invocation of macro {demoMacro}.

The page "include" should contain the include of page "original": {include:original}.

When you export page "original" to word, the output will be "word", which is correct.

When you export page "include" to word, the output will be "display", which I assume is incorrect.
fields.summary: Incorrect return value from RenderContext.getOutputType() in an included page when exporting to word

From CONF-14720:

* Use Firefox
* Add a page, and using the RTE enter some text followed by a new paragraph
* With the cursor in the new paragraph, open the Macro Browser, then click cancel

The cursor has now jumped to the beginning of the page text.

fields.description:
* Add new page, enter some text in the RTE
* Highlight this text, and use the Macro Browser to enclose it in a section macro (or any other body macro)
* Manually delete both tags.
* Highlight the text again, and use the Macro Browser to enclose it in a section macro.

The message is returned:

bq. Macros with the same name cannot be nested inside each other.


The user should not see this message, as they have removed the first instance of the macro.
fields.summary: Macro Bowser is preventing nested macros of the same name, even when the first macro has been deleted

fields.description:

The arrow triggers the menu correctly using Firefox 3.

fields.description: Using Internet Explorer 7 there is a noticeable 1-2 second delay when mousing over pull down menus such as Browse, Tools, Edit, etc. This is instantaneous with Firefox 3.

fields.description:
* Set the permissions so that anonymous users can use Confluence, but can't view user profiles.
* As a logged-in user, load a Confluence page containing a username.
* Allow your session to time out (or log out manually in a different window)
* In the previously loaded page, hover over the username

The hover profile window is loaded, but as the user is no longer logged in they will see the login screen as the content. This looks really bad.
fields.summary: User Hover can display the login screen after a user is timed out

fields.description:

I know that the window in my example is not "regulation" size but it needs to be semi-useable in this state.
fields.summary: Macro browser Dialog useless when the screen is too small

fields.description: Often I want to watch all the pages I create, so that I can respond to people who comment on those pages. Yes I can watch my own space, but if I create pages outside my space I'd probably like to be watching them by default. I'd suggest a (default checked) checkbox when I create a new page saying 'Watch this page', or at least a user setting which would allow the default to be watching any created pages.
fields.summary: Automatically watch all my created pages

fields.description: Clicking on my name in the drop down menu on the top left does nothing (yes mousing over it expands the menu, but clicking). I should be able to simply click on this for a default/most used option - in this case I would expect navigation to my own space, I shouldn't have to expand the menu first. Same goes for the other drop down menus. (I think facebook does this.)

Edit page, insert macro, upload attachment, submit, save the page.

fields.description:
It seems that png files, which were edited with Adobe Firework by adding layers and objects aren't generated as Thumbnail anymore. An example is [^Bild 1.png] !Bild 1.png! which was created by editing [^Bild 1_orig.png] !Bild 1_orig.png!, which is a simple Screenshop produced with Mac OS X 10.5 h2.Testcase This case was reproduced with other edited pngs as well. The Testcase is the Wiki-Markup {code} !Bild 1_orig.png|thumbnail! !Bild 1_orig.png! !Bild 1.png|thumbnail! !Bild 1.png! {code} The given PNGs [^Bild 1_orig.png] and [^Bild 1.png] are attachments of the page. h2.Results In the preview, the output is !Bild 12.png! and on the saved page, nothing is visible at all. !Bild 13.png! The generated HTML-Code for this part is {code}




{code} Trying to access {code} http://intra.grueneerde.com/download/thumbnails/5800001/Bild%201.png {code} brings up the exception {code} java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: Thumbnail file for attachment Bild 1.png is '/data/confluence/thumbnails/5800001/thumb_Bild 1.png'. But this file does not exist. {code} For full error page see [^RuntimeException.html] As I can see, thumbnailing this things at least works in this Jira-Version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15729].
  {panel}

Confluence does not currently support partial downloads of attachment content using the standard "Range" header.  This means that the download of attachments cannot be resumed if interrupted.

Steps to confirm the current behavior:
# Locate the full URL of an attachment stored in Confluence, such as: \\ http://localhost:8080/confluence/download/attachments/32792/orly.jpg
# Telnet to the appropriate port on a machine running Confluence 2.10.3
# Make a partial request by entering the following text: {code}GET /confluence/download/attachments/32792/orly.jpg HTTP/1.1
Range: bytes=0-16
Host: localhost


{code}
# Only 16 bytes should be returned, instead the whole file is returned.
fields.summary: Add support for partial attachment downloads

fields.description:
Seems to be an issue with certain images in Powerpoint files, Confluence will display the "<filename>.ppt is being converted. Please refresh after some time" message repeatedly and the file itself never converts.

Stack trace issued during the conversion is as follows:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.benryan.graphics.emf.GdiBrush.<init>(GdiBrush.java:89)
	at com.benryan.graphics.emf.DeviceContext.copy(DeviceContext.java:263)
	at com.benryan.graphics.emf.DeviceContext.<init>(DeviceContext.java:230)
	at com.benryan.graphics.emf.DeviceContext.saveDC(DeviceContext.java:276)
	at com.benryan.graphics.emf.SaveDC.render(SaveDC.java:40)
	at com.benryan.graphics.emf.AbstractTranscoder.iterateRecords(AbstractTranscoder.java:248)
	at com.benryan.graphics.emf.AbstractTranscoder.doRender(AbstractTranscoder.java:207)
	at com.benryan.graphics.emf.AbstractTranscoder.transcode(AbstractTranscoder.java:137)
	at com.benryan.escher.EscherRenderer.renderImage(EscherRenderer.java:168)
	at com.benryan.escher.EscherRenderer.walkShapes(EscherRenderer.java:235)
	at com.benryan.ppt.PptRenderer.render(PptRenderer.java:95)
	at com.benryan.conversion.SlideConversionThread.convertFile(SlideConversionThread.java:64)
	at com.benryan.conversion.SlideConversionThread.run(SlideConversionThread.java:137)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:417)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:269)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:123)

The following query is inefficient as the content table grows:

{noformat}
select  page0_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID0_,
        comments1_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID1_,
        children2_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID2_,
        page0_.CHILD_POSITION as CHILD_P13_0_,
        page0_.PARENTID as PARENTID0_,
        page0_.SPACEID as SPACEID0_,
        page0_.TITLE as TITLE0_,
        page0_.VERSION as VERSION0_,
        page0_.CREATOR as CREATOR0_,
        page0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_0_,
        page0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_0_,
        page0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_0_,
        page0_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_0_,
        page0_.PREVVER as PREVVER0_,
        page0_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_0_,
        comments1_.PAGEID as PAGEID1_,
        comments1_.PARENTCOMMENTID as PARENTC21_1_,
        comments1_.TITLE as TITLE1_,
        comments1_.VERSION as VERSION1_,
        comments1_.CREATOR as CREATOR1_,
        comments1_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_1_,
        comments1_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_1_,
        comments1_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_1_,
        comments1_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_1_,
        comments1_.PREVVER as PREVVER1_,
        comments1_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_1_,
        children2_.PAGEID as PAGEID2_,
        children2_.PARENTCOMMENTID as PARENTC21_2_,
        children2_.TITLE as TITLE2_,
        children2_.VERSION as VERSION2_,
        children2_.CREATOR as CREATOR2_,
        children2_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_2_,
        children2_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_2_,
        children2_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_2_,
        children2_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_2_,
        children2_.PREVVER as PREVVER2_,
        children2_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_2_,
        children2_.PARENTCOMMENTID as PARENTC21___,
        children2_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID__
from CONTENT page0_
left outer join CONTENT comments1_ on page0_.CONTENTID=comments1_.PAGEID
left outer join CONTENT children2_ on comments1_.CONTENTID=children2_.PARENTCOMMENTID
where page0_.CONTENTTYPE='PAGE'
        and ((page0_.CONTENTID=144212101)
        and (page0_.PREVVER is null ) 
        and (page0_.CONTENT_STATUS='current' ))
order by children2_.CREATIONDATE

                                                            QUERY PLAN                                                             
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Sort  (cost=195038.64..195041.80 rows=1261 width=6448)
   Sort Key: children2_.creationdate
   ->  Nested Loop Left Join  (cost=80460.77..191480.70 rows=1261 width=6448)
         ->  Index Scan using content_pkey on content page0_  (cost=0.00..8.30 rows=1 width=2152)
               Index Cond: (contentid = 144212101)
               Filter: (((contenttype)::text = 'PAGE'::text) AND (prevver IS NULL) AND ((content_status)::text = 'current'::text))
         ->  Hash Left Join  (cost=80460.77..191459.79 rows=1261 width=4296)
               Hash Cond: (comments1_.contentid = children2_.parentcommentid)
               ->  Bitmap Heap Scan on content comments1_  (cost=30.06..3326.41 rows=1261 width=2148)
                     Recheck Cond: (pageid = 144212101)
                     ->  Bitmap Index Scan on ix6382c0598c38fbea  (cost=0.00..29.74 rows=1261 width=0)
                           Index Cond: (pageid = 144212101)
               ->  Hash  (cost=10025.54..10025.54 rows=252254 width=2148)
                     ->  Seq Scan on content children2_  (cost=0.00..10025.54 rows=252254 width=2148)
{noformat}

This query can be improved by being more specific on the first join

{noformat}
select  page0_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID0_,
        comments1_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID1_,
        children2_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID2_,
        page0_.CHILD_POSITION as CHILD_P13_0_,
        page0_.PARENTID as PARENTID0_,
        page0_.SPACEID as SPACEID0_,
        page0_.TITLE as TITLE0_,
        page0_.VERSION as VERSION0_,
        page0_.CREATOR as CREATOR0_,
        page0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_0_,
        page0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_0_,
        page0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_0_,
        page0_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_0_,
        page0_.PREVVER as PREVVER0_,
        page0_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_0_,
        comments1_.PAGEID as PAGEID1_,
        comments1_.PARENTCOMMENTID as PARENTC21_1_,
        comments1_.TITLE as TITLE1_,
        comments1_.VERSION as VERSION1_,
        comments1_.CREATOR as CREATOR1_,
        comments1_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_1_,
        comments1_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_1_,
        comments1_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_1_,
        comments1_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_1_,
        comments1_.PREVVER as PREVVER1_,
        comments1_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_1_,
        children2_.PAGEID as PAGEID2_,
        children2_.PARENTCOMMENTID as PARENTC21_2_,
        children2_.TITLE as TITLE2_,
        children2_.VERSION as VERSION2_,
        children2_.CREATOR as CREATOR2_,
        children2_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_2_,
        children2_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_2_,
        children2_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_2_,
        children2_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_2_,
        children2_.PREVVER as PREVVER2_,
        children2_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_2_,
        children2_.PARENTCOMMENTID as PARENTC21___,
        children2_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID__
from CONTENT page0_
left outer join CONTENT comments1_ on page0_.CONTENTID=comments1_.PAGEID and page0_.CONTENTID=144212101
left outer join CONTENT children2_ on comments1_.CONTENTID=children2_.PARENTCOMMENTID
where page0_.CONTENTTYPE='PAGE'
        and (
          (page0_.CONTENTID=144212101)
           and (page0_.PREVVER is null ) 
           and (page0_.CONTENT_STATUS='current' )
        )
order by children2_.CREATIONDATE

                                                               QUERY PLAN                                                                
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Sort  (cost=4649.09..4649.10 rows=1 width=6448)
   Sort Key: children2_.creationdate
   ->  Nested Loop Left Join  (cost=45.82..4649.08 rows=1 width=6448)
         ->  Nested Loop Left Join  (cost=30.06..3350.47 rows=1 width=4300)
               Join Filter: (page0_.contentid = 144212101)
               ->  Index Scan using content_pkey on content page0_  (cost=0.00..8.30 rows=1 width=2152)
                     Index Cond: (contentid = 144212101)
                     Filter: (((contenttype)::text = 'PAGE'::text) AND (prevver IS NULL) AND ((content_status)::text = 'current'::text))
               ->  Bitmap Heap Scan on content comments1_  (cost=30.06..3326.41 rows=1261 width=2148)
                     Recheck Cond: (pageid = 144212101)

                           Index Cond: (pageid = 144212101)

The navigation for linking to individual status updates is rather confusing. There are 5 different places where a status update can appear, and there are 4 different linking methods:

* Clicking on the time of the update
* Clicking on the quotation mark symbol
* Clicking on the permlink symbol
* Clicking on the actual text of the status update.

Each of these methods would be fine, if it was used consistently throughout the pages. But currently it is very confusing trying to work out which is the link depending on where you are.
